title: Socioeconomic Impacts of Insurance on Colorectal Cancer Mortality: Insights from the National Inpatient Sample
text:
Reference Paper: Akinyemiju et al. 2016
Study Objective: Examine the impact of healthcare insurance on in-hospital mortality and length of stay among patients with colorectal cancer (CRC).
Data Source: Cross-sectional analysis of the National Inpatient Sample (NIS) from 2018 to 2020.
Patient Selection: Included all hospitalized patients diagnosed with CRC.
Insurance Categories:

Medicare
Medicaid
Private
Other

Primary Outcomes:

In-hospital all-cause mortality
Total hospital length of stay (days)

Software: All analyses were performed using R Version 4.4.1 (R Foundation for Statistical Computing, Vienna, Austria)
